clinical_study.brief_title: Medical Education Intervention for Medical Students
clinical_study.official_title: Intervention to Promote Medical Students Empathy, Well-being and Study emotion-a Randomized Clinical Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: The doctor-patient relationship was becoming worse. More and more work-related violence has happened to physicians and nurses. A portion of medical students felt depressed and thought that the career future was gloomy. The study was designed to measure the empathy, an vital element of professionalism, well-being of mental and study emotion. Furthermore, the investigators explored an intervention of group study to promote medical students' professionalism, mental health and study emotion.

detailed_description.textblock: A total number of 200 junior medical students are going to be enrolled according to inclusive criteria. They are divided into two groups, one group is given education about medical humanities when the other group is not given any intervention but the same room and time.The outcomes including empathy, depression, quality of life, burnout and self-efficiency are measured before, during and after the trial.

primary_outcome.description: we plan to use the scale"The Jefferson Scale of Physician Empathy" to measure medical students' empathy

secondary_outcome.description: we plan to use the scale"Maslach Burnout Inventory" to measure medical students' burnout

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life of Medical students
secondary_outcome.description: we plan to use the scale"MOS SF-8 Health Survey" to measure medical students' quality of life
we plan to use the "General Self-Efficacy Scale" to measure medical students' self-efficiency
we plan to use the "Patient Health Questionnaire-9" to measure medical students' depression

arm_group.description: Medical students rolled into this group would accept education of medical humanities.
Medical students rolled into this group would not gain education of medical humanities.

intervention.description: The medical students in the intervention group would gain education about the medical humanities, but not the control group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1 age 18 to 25 years
- 2 junior students majoring in clinical medicine
- 3 no mental diseases previously
Exclusion Criteria:
- Did not meet inclusion criteria
